meta.title: An Overview of the Chamling Region

nodes.body: The Chamling are a Rai ethnic group of eastern Nepal who speak a Tibeto-Burman language of the same name and which is a Kiranti language. According to the 2001 census of Nepal, 44,093 people speak Chamling as a mother tongue. (Mark Turin â€“ June 01, 2004)
nodes.title: An Overview of the Chamling Region
